skill.name: gene-database
skill.description: Query NCBI Gene via E-utilities/Datasets API. Search by symbol/ID, retrieve gene info (RefSeqs, GO, locations, phenotypes), batch lookups, for gene annotation and functional analysis.
skill.summary: Query NCBI Gene via E-utilities/Datasets API. Search by symbol/ID, retrieve gene info (RefSeqs, GO, ...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: The gene-database skill is a legitimate bioinformatics tool for querying NCBI Gene database. Static analysis flagged false positives from documentation examples and standard API usage patterns. No malicious intent detected.

content.user_title: Query NCBI Gene Database for Bioinformatics Research
content.value_statement: Researchers need efficient access to comprehensive gene data for analysis. This skill provides direct integration with NCBI Gene database via E-utilities and Datasets APIs for searching, retrieving, and batch processing gene information.
actual_capabilities: Search genes by symbol, name, or biological context
Retrieve detailed gene information including sequences and annotations
Perform batch lookups for multiple genes efficiently
Access Gene Ontology terms and phenotype associations
Query by chromosome location or disease associations
Handle rate limiting with optional API key support
limitations: Requires internet connection to access NCBI APIs
Rate limited without API key (3-5 requests/second)
Limited to genes available in NCBI Gene database
Batch processing subject to API rate limits

use_cases.title: Annotate gene lists with functional data
use_cases.description: Upload a list of gene symbols and retrieve comprehensive annotations including GO terms, pathways, and phenotypes for downstream analysis.

use_cases.title: Find genes by disease association
use_cases.description: Search for genes associated with specific diseases or phenotypes to identify potential research targets or biomarkers.

use_cases.title: Build gene annotation pipelines
use_cases.description: Integrate gene database queries into automated pipelines for processing high-throughput genomic data with standardized annotations.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Gene Search
prompt_templates.scenario: Find a specific gene by symbol
prompt_templates.prompt: Search for the BRCA1 gene in humans and show me its gene ID and basic information

prompt_templates.title: Batch Gene Lookup
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a list of genes: TP53, BRCA1, EGFR. Look up all three in humans and return their chromosomal locations and GO annotations

prompt_templates.title: Disease Association Search
prompt_templates.scenario: Find genes linked to a disease
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all genes associated with diabetes in humans and show their symbols and brief descriptions

prompt_templates.title: Advanced Biological Query
prompt_templates.prompt: Search for genes involved in apoptosis (GO:0006915) on chromosome 17 in humans, and return their RefSeq IDs

output_examples.input: Look up gene BRCA1 in humans
output: GO Terms: DNA repair, double-strand break repair, response to DNA damage stimulus

best_practices: Always specify organism when searching by gene symbol to avoid ambiguity
Use batch processing for multiple genes to minimize API calls and respect rate limits
Include NCBI API key in requests for higher rate limits (10 vs 3 requests/second)
anti_patterns: Don't make rapid sequential requests without rate limiting - use built-in delays
Avoid searching only by gene symbol without organism context - many genes have similar names
Don't ignore error responses - implement proper error handling for failed requests

faq.question: Do I need an API key to use this skill?
faq.answer: No, but having one increases rate limits from 3 to 10 requests per second. Get a free key at ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/account/

faq.question: What organisms are supported?
faq.answer: All organisms with gene data in NCBI Gene database, including human, mouse, rat, and thousands of other species

faq.question: Can I search by protein sequence?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on gene-level queries. For protein sequences, use NCBI Protein database or BLAST tools

faq.question: How do I handle rate limiting errors?
faq.answer: The scripts include automatic retry with exponential backoff. With API key, you get 10 requests/second

faq.question: What's the difference between E-utilities and Datasets API?
faq.answer: E-utilities is traditional with full query flexibility. Datasets API is newer, optimized for gene data with simpler workflows

faq.question: Can I export results to different formats?
faq.answer: Yes, scripts support JSON, XML, and text output formats. JSON is recommended for programmatic processing
